Description: Fragment of a thin silver-gilt band or diadem, stamped with alternate palmettes and lotus flowers; the palmettes are surrounded by a semicircular band which terminates below in a double spiral twist on either side; underneath are similar palmettes and inverted lotus-flowers.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: Probably made specially for funerary use. See also R. Laffineur, La nécropole d'Amathonte. Tomb 113-367. VI. Bijoux, armes, verre, astragales et coquillages, squelettes (Nicosia 1992), pp. 23-24; pls. VII-VIII. Originally had more than one entry in the register; the other numbers were 1894,1101.613-4.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (1616)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.118, Tomb 51; pl. XIV, 25)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 70, p.24)
